question: How long till we're across the border?
answer: We've been over for the past hour. The group continues along the ridge.

question: What are you looking at, hotshot?
answer: Why don't you light a bonfire?

question: You give up being the D.A. and hurry up and find the right fella, Jax. You might have time for one of these yourself. Watanabe! Say hey, Doc.
answer: You're a father now. Are you gonna take me up on my offer?

question: I'm happy, Branca. I like what I do. Branca glances seriously to the other uncles, then, with a smile, pats Nico's cheek.
answer: Look at this face! Six-foot-four, pretty as the statue of David. And he's a cop! Branca laughs. From a distance, Watanabe watches, missing nothing. Across the porch, Lukich and several other cops observe and try to listen. This face should be sticking up from a white shirt. It should be a banker, a businessman, someone who earns a decent living for his family!

question: We're happy. An art gallery.
answer: Same thing. She wants a husband who carries a briefcase, not a shoulder holster. Jackson watches Nico trying to keep his good humor. This is serious stuff, despite the light tone. Branca's eyes meet Nico's. You wanted to get shot, you got shot. You wanted to get knifed, you got knifed. You've had your fun. Basta! Enough!

question: Uncle Gio, that kind of help I don't need. I'd rather get shot by someone I don't know. Jackson and Lukich crack up. The others follow. For the moment, the tension is dispelled. What are you doing in here, Mama? Go join the party... Nico comes down the hall, tucking in his shirt -- stops to give his mother a squeeze. O.S. from the bedroom Mrs. Z. Is this a way to act on the day of my son's baptism? The poor woman can't meet Nico's eyes. It's that kid from the bar on Damen? The one with the drugs? Listen to me, Mrs. Z. Are you listening? I have to go to work now. But I'll come by tonight. You'll be at the bakery? We'll talk, okay? We'll find a way to take care of this.
answer: Unit Ten Tango X-ray. We're up and clear.

question: I promised the Lieutenant, I'm gonna take care of you. Broken windows and lost kittens for your last week. WIDEN SHOT to include Nico and Jackson.
answer: And then you're gonna come visit me in a nice, clean, air conditioned office --

question: I gotta take a quick leak. Stay put. Gentlemen. One Jacket treats him like he doesn't exist, and begins to pick his nose. You seen this girl? That's witty. Come on. Show me something. No one moves. I get it. It's a gay bar. Is that it? You seen the top of her head, huh? Like I seen your mother's -- Or was it yours? Or yours? I couldn't tell, it looked like her ass -- Nico rages like a beast. Come on, motherfuckers. Do it. Do it! One man -- Nico lunges for the Bad Dude, grabs him like he's about to tear his face off -- You cocksuckers are brave enough with 14-year-old girls. Get outta here. We look in the apartment. This ain't your day, kid.
answer: Wait, man. It ain't like it looks --

question: That's two years. He jerks the Pimp back, rips open a drawer. More pills and glacene bags. That's four. She'll get you eight more. And I'm just warming up -- Lucy is crying hysterically. Nico flings the Pimp, face * bloody, toward the open door. *
answer: Take it, baby. It's all yours --

question: Get your clothes on, Lucy.
answer: There's money. Three grand in the mattress... ... I can get ya more --

question: Not when I get through with him. Nico lifts the Pimp by the throat, pins him to the wall.
answer: No, man, wait! I'll give you something! Something big! It's huge! I swear it! A shipment... coming in next Tuesday --

question: Shipment, my ass.
answer: This is square! On my mother's soul! You can't send me up -- Nico glances to Lucy. Half of him wants to tear the Pimp apart, the other half doesn't want to make the poor girl's life any more tragic. Besides, he's a good cop -- and maybe this "shipment" is on the level. I heard it from a hooker friend of mine. She's banging some big coke lawyer, he told her. I swear to Jesus!

question: What lawyer?
answer: I don't know. That platinum chola... Carla DeCarlo... she knows. Nico tightens his grip on the Pimp's throat. She got popped this afternoon. She's downtown. Red dress, lizard shoes --

question: It's okay, girl. Mama Jax is here. That was some leak you took. From the door of the bar, several bloodied heads peek. Broken windows and lost pussy cats, huh. Jackson checks out her battered partner. You're one crazy bastard, Toscani. Nico opens the rear door, helps Jackson ease Lucy in.
answer: We'll get her some clothes and a bath. I'm not bringing her home to her grandmother like this. DISSOLVE TO:

question: I don't get you, Toscani. What the hell are you doing being a shitheel cop? With your background? For a long moment Nico says nothing. Then, quietly, look- ing straight ahead:
answer: When I was overseas, I saw some things. Things that eat your guts out. Things that stay in front of your eyes like they were burned in and branded. He turns to Jackson. You can walk away from them, Jax. You can quit, but you know it's still going on. You try something anyway -- -- I know I'm not going to change the world. I can't stop the tonnage coming in, I can't fight the boys behind the desks pushing their buttons -- But maybe here, huh? Maybe in my own city, my own neighborhood, on my own block -- maybe here I can do something. That's why I'm a shitheel cop. Carla... Carla -- I just want the name of your boyfriend --

question: Why can't you sons-a-bitches ever treat someone with a little respect?
answer: Take it easy, sister.

question: I ain't your goddamn sister. We ain't got the same mother, motherfucka. Carla fires one final parting salvo of obscenities, then sags back among the women. Carla starts to cry. Jackson comforts her; Carla responds, lets herself be comforted. CUT TO: The lawyer's name is Abandano. He's on the third floor. I got a look at him. I couldn't get how he's connected, but according to Carla, he's a lousy lay.
answer: Maybe we can bust him for that. Jackson spots something, gestures subtly out window --

question: Toscani, you're going to have me doing time.
answer: Lighten up, Jax. No one's bringing this into court.

question: Except against us.
answer: I don't give a shit how we do it. I just wanna get there. Jackson gives Nico a dirty look, but stifles her protest.

question: I thought you said you were gonna protect me. Cover my butt. Be my guardian angel -- Nico hears something through the earphones. Gestures for silence --
answer: I got the shipment. *

question: What? What's he saying?
answer: '... Engine block has cleared customs. Serial number VA-748. Pick up Tuesday, 3 May as authorized.' Unit Ten Tango X-ray. I need a vehicle registration I.D. '86 Lincoln. Illinois 354 Dog '67. * I want to know when he wipes his * behind. *

question: Salvano?
answer: Jackpot. Two for drinks. They elbow up to the packed bar, standing. Nico squints toward the rear dining room.

question: Gimme something stiff. I need it.
answer: You'll have your engine block next Tuesday, boss.

question: Why couldn't it be a week from Tuesday? I could read about it in the paper. Nico grabs her waist, pulls her onto the dance floor, and does a playful twirl.
answer: Cheer up, partner. I'm gonna make you famous.

question: -- This is no reflection on the work you officers have done. I feel, and the whole department feels, extremely proud of your initiative and gallantry. That "spare me the horseshit" look on Nico's face. He's fuming. Strozah sees Nico's bitter expression. It's on the others' faces too. As all of you are well aware, possession of these explosives is a federal offense and under jurisdiction of the F.B.I. Nico's eyes meet Lieutenant Strozah's. There's respect between the two, but it's plainly under a helluva strain.
answer: Sir. With all respect to our brothers in the Bureau -- * -- That's no answer. It's no answer to why one of the biggest dealers in the city is out on the street now, free as a bird!

question: Keep it in your pants, Nico. These men have a job to do, just like us. Nico stifles his outrage. The other cops exchange glances -- upset and angry. Agent Neeley clears his throat. * The tapes too.
answer: That's my Lawrence Welk collection!

question: What's the story on your partner, Jackson? Did he learn this style or was he born with a brick up his ass? Jackson checks Halloran out. He's black too and, despite herself, there's a certain rapport.
answer: He has ethics. Unlike certain others on this case.

question: His 'ethics' are gonna cost him his badge and his gun.
answer: You don't wanna catch him without no gun. Halloran's look asks why not? 'Cause what he do with his hands... make bullet holes look pretty.

question: He bad?
answer: Bad bad. Is that enough? Can we do something normal now -- like eat lunch?

question: Bad bad. Is that enough? Can we do something normal now -- like eat lunch?
answer: Anything you say, Jax. How about Salvano's?

question: Let it be, Nico. What... you kept his tape, too? Nico already has it in the PLAYER. We hear FRAGMENTS of the telephone tap from the body shop in Spanish and English. Jackson looks frustrated. Nico listens care- fully to what appears to be the taped PHONE CONVERSATION.
answer: Poetry, ain't it? 140 EXT. REAR SALVANO'S RESTAURANT - DAY And now for some dessert. And that must be Mrs. Sal. So nice to see married couples still in love.

question: This is your mother's church, isn't it?
answer: Yeah. But I bet she's never seen these boys in the choir.

question: Yes. But, perhaps not such a safe one.
answer: How long have they been here?

question: Too long. At least the kids can go to our school.
answer: Who did it, Father?

question: No... please. Police frighten these people.
answer: Really, I don't mind coming by.

question: Tell me, Nico... When was your last confession?
answer: I'm a married man, Father. I've got no sins to confess.

question: Help each other move outside. Be calm. Call 911. Tell 'em to send everything they got! Sara, get the baby and Mama * outside. Nico starts for the altar where the damage is worst. I want a list of everyone that's been treated here today. Everyone.
answer: Right.

question: Then find those sanctuary people, the ones we saw in the church basement -- As Jackson makes notes. Find out where they're from, why anyone would want to harm them.
answer: Where are you gonna be?

question: Just stay near a radio. I'll find you. Sara... go down to the car; I'll * be with you in a minute. He hails Neeley. * I need to talk to you. ... Alone. Neeley nods. Nico leads him off the corridor, through a * fire exit door -- You. That's what the hell it is! AGENT NEELEY * Get your goddam hands off me! Neeley tries to shake free; Nico won't let him. * You let Salvano walk. AGENT NEELEY * Salvano?! Are you crazy? What does he have to do with this? That was no cherry bomb in there. That was C-fucking-4! I've used that shit. I know what it smells like, I know what it blows like -- I tailed Salvano. Two days ago. Him and one of his apes were in that church -- and they weren't taking communion. I saw some broad saw who was with his lawyer plant the bomb. Now I want some goddamn answers. AGENT NEELEY * You tailed him? After I ordered you off? Where is he? Where's Salvano? AGENT NEELEY * My orders were release him. Not babysit him. Neeley brushes Nico's fingermarks off his lapels. * AGENT NEELEY * You think you're rough stuff, Toscani -- martial arts hero, chop suey crap. Well I'll tell you something I want the agent who signed for the explosives. Bank on it, pal.
answer: You come to our streets... fuck with our people. Now our people gonna fuck with you. No, hermano. Please --

question: Who put up the money?
answer: What money?

question: You didn't come after me for a piece of ass. Who paid you?
answer: I told ya! No one! Nico slams him with a fierce shot to the ribs. The hood doubles over, gasping. The flower girls shriek even louder. Nico turns to the girls with a ferocious glare.

question: Shut up! The girls instantly go silent in terror. Nico turns back to Machete Man, spins him violently face-down, jacking the punk's right arm straight out behind him. We see that Nico can break his elbow with one blow. Give it to me! Nico raises his fist to strike.
answer: Jimmy Constanza! Nico shoves the hood into the ground, tearing the hood's wallet from his trouser pocket. Nico rips the wallet a- part, seizes the kid's identification and holds it up. He grabs the punk by the hair with his free hand. Machete Man is staring up in terror, wondering what this means.

question: If you're lying to me, I'll come and kill you right in your own fucking kitchen.
answer: Salvano! Bautista Salvano!

question: Gracias, muchacho. Nico walks away. Of course I will. I've been waiting to hear from Jax. She was supposed to get back to me by now.
answer: Thank God you couldn't find your shoes. We would of have been sitting in the front row. Alright, I know the rules -- I don't ask you don't tell. But could've died today and I deserve to know. Why did we go to church this morning?

question: I'm willing to break the rules; I'm willing to tell you whatever I know. But I need some time. Could you just give me some time? Nico leans to kiss her, but is cut off by the HARSH RING of a PHONE. Sara starts at the sound. She and Nico glance at each other --
answer: I'll bet that's her. Nico picks up the phone.

question: Check that coat.
answer: It's all a mistake, Sara -- It's * gonna be all right. The cops steer Nico toward the door.

question: Illegal wiretaps. Unauthorized surveillance.
answer: When were you born, asshole? AGENT NEELEY * Associating with known felons. Disobeying direct orders -- Where's Jackson?

question: You're the rotten apple in this barrel, Toscani. We don't have to look any farther than you and your 'family.'
answer: You'll never build a frame on this chickenshit. AGENT NEELEY * You were ordered to back off on Salvano. But you had too big a hard-on for that, didn't you-- Fred. You can't be in on this. Nico faces his lieutenant -- a look that calls on long * years of comradeship and loyalty. Strozah is torn. He's a good man, over his head in a situation he doesn't com- pletely understand. LIEUTENANT STROZAH * You're officially suspended, Toscani. I want your tin... and your iron. Neeley leans past Nico; drops Nico's gun onto the table. Nico looks to Strozah, who averts his eyes. Nico flips his badge onto the table. You holding me? Sara, I'm okay. I love you. * I'll be home later. Lukich will * be there. Tell mama not to worry. Jackson and Lukich are waiting by Nico's car. They see Nico emerge from the phone booth.

question: Luke. I want you to go to my house. Call Branca... my mother has the number. Get my family ready to move out.
answer: You got it, buddy.

question: Stay with 'em. We'll be there.
answer: What's going on, Nico? What happened?

question: I got a call last night. An old agency friend. He told me my family was in danger. Jax and Lukich can't put all the pieces together yet. But if it's drugs-CIA-Senate, it's got to be heavy.
answer: You got a weapon? Lukich knows he doesn't. He glances up and down the street, makes sure no one's watching -- then cracks the driver's door of his car. There's a bulge in the map pocket. Nico pulls out a Sig Saur .45. Try this on. Jackson watches Luke slip Nico a clip. * CUT TO:

question: I am if you are. SARA * Don't worry -- We needed a vacation, anyway. Sara takes her suitcase, hurries out -- * * I'll give you five minutes start. We have to do it this way. They get their suitcases into the sedan. Mama and the baby are already aboard. Sara gets into the passenger seat. * Lukich comes around from the front, glancing around like a lookout. Where's Jax?
answer: She thinks there may be documents at some guy's apartment.

question: They killed the wrong priest. Lukich doesn't understand. There was a second priest... from Costa Rica... hiding at the church. He was the one they meant to kill. Nico starts to remove a large piece of ducting from the basement heater.
answer: And you know where to find him?

question: No.
answer: You're gonna need help. Nico grabs the pistols, starts to strap them on.

question: Just stay with my family Nico replaces the piece of foundation, starts back up the steps.
answer: What are you gonna do?

question: Don't forget your seat belt. Keep walking -- -- I'm bucking for number one.
answer: What can I do for you, lads? Neeley presents his ID. * Hell, that's gone.

question: When?
answer: Right away, pardner. They scooped that stuff outa here before we even got it tagged.

question: Who? Who took it?
answer: You gotta sign. Yeah... I remember that guy. Flew in special from Langley. Bomb tech. Real nice fella -- -- Here it is. Fox. Nelson Fox.

question: Dump your shoes. Ditch your I.D. on the floor. Nico watches the FBI man obey. So you think I'm a lousy cop, huh, Neeley? Maybe I am. But I haven't got * my face buried up Washington's ass. AGENT NEELEY * Nobody buys me, Toscani. Yeah? Then somebody pulled the plug on your brain, pal. You didn't come up with the second priest, did you? Or Harrison's dead aide. Hurry up! * You heard the radio. The Agency's pushing buttons and bodies are dropping like flies. You assholes are missing half the case! Watch your step.
answer: So good to see you again, sir! Come back near closing... five- thirty... we'll place your order then. Nico nods, fades like a shadow into the throng. MUSIC DOWN, SEQUENCE ENDS -- emerges with Nico from behind a booth divider, leads her * old friend at a brisk pace across the deserted floor.

question: Listen, Wat... you know I wouldn't call in a favor --
answer: Of course not. Just because you kept a few 'friendly' tribesmen from cutting my heart out and serving it up as Pad Thai? With a wink, Watanabe escorts Nico into a back area off the floor. Carpeted office dividers set off a small area, packed with super sophisticated computer equipment. The last six years I've been risking nothing but money. It's a kick to risk my ass again.

question: -- No way to access Covert Ops directly. But Ornstein's at Princeton, he's got a database bigger than Langley -- If I can't crack that turkey's code, it's time to hang up my rock and roll shoes -- Nico watches Watanabe work. -- ah, here! Here's a little trap door. Let's see if we can wriggle up into -- Personnel files! Operative dossiers. Will that do?
answer: It's a start. Nico sits down beside Watanabe. DISSOLVE TO: Fox has had a helluva career. '69 to '76, Cambodia, Laos. Operation Phoenix. Operation Green Mountain. Operaton Northstar. This is all Vang Pao, it's all heroin --

question: You friend has found his metier.
answer: Run personnel retrievals on all these operations. I want the names of every company man who was on them. Altshuler. Cosgrove. I know half these guys -- Okay... now run me an update. Where are these fuckers now? QUICK DISSOLVE TO:

question: Central American desk. Central American desk. Central --
answer: Thirty names from secret drug operations... and two-thirds of 'em are in Central America. All right. Run these two names

question: Those street dealers you were talking about? They're not gonna be in here. Nico gives her a look. Watanabe starts punching keys. * Well, kiss my ass. Both former Somoza secret police. Recruited by agency, 1975. Trained Fort Benning, counter insurgency...
answer: Where's Fox's printout? 1976... Fort Benning. He recruited these pricks! DISSOLVE TO:

question: There's nothing left, Nico. We've wrung these files dry.
answer: Fox is here, in Chicago... or was here... ... Listen. Can this thing tap into airlines? Reservations records --

question: I can get you the ball scores, too. DISSOLVE TO:
answer: Five agents from Central American desk. All trained assassins. All arrived in Chicago in the last week -- and none of them has left. Nico grabs his coat, gulps a last swallow of coffee -- Thanks, Wat. You finally may have done some good for your country.

question: Where are you going?
answer: To find a priest. How did ya find him?

question: You'll be in heaven in a few minutes, padre. But first I'm going to put you through hell. You came here to talk to the * Senator's aide, didn't you? *
answer: I tried. But you killed him first. *

question: Who told you about our plans? *
answer: This is from confession. I tell no one.

question: Speak to me, Father -- who did you tell?
answer: I know what you are. I know what beasts you are.

question: I want to know who you told.
answer: I told them... you make the ninos... see... castrating their fathers -- raping... mutilating their mothers ... And... ... and sometimes... to the ninos...

question: -- Tell me the truth, Father -- The priest's eyes roll grotesquely; he convulses, sweat beading on his forehead. He looks like a man in the agonies of some narcotic hell. -- Can we kill him? If you told anyone, about our plans to kill the senator, we cannot do it.
answer: Nadie. Nadie. Nadie. *

question: Jesus Christ!
answer: The motherfuckas got Jackson.

question: Lukich called. She's not dead. She's gonna make it. She was wearing a vest. Nico can't believe it. In spite of it all, life comes to him. A little smile...
answer: That broad didn't trust me. CUT TO:

question: Ever notice how clean babies smell? Like nothing in the world has touched them yet.
answer: If you won't go to him, I will.

question: Don't push me like this -- Her eyes meet his -- loving, but desperate.
answer: Branca can put us on a plane -- but where can we fly to? Tibet? The moon? There's nowhere they can't find us.

question: You don't know what the hell you're talking about.
answer: I'm talking about everything I've learned from you in the past five years.

question: You know I can't go to him. Sara takes both his hands in hers.
answer: Do you know why I love you? Do you know what it is about you that I've always loved? Pride. It's what you have inside. You don't live the way other people live. You trust what you see as right and won't let anyone or anything make you stray from it. But now that pride may kill all of us. You've got to swallow that pride, Nico. Choke on it if you have to. Lay it aside.

question: I am only an old man. An old man with a cancer. The two are like an old and a young lion, appraising each other -- using all five senses and more.
answer: I don't have much time, Uncle. So I must speak plainly. Larusso listens. Nico waits for a beat. Then: -- For as long as I've been old enough to think, I've hated you and hated everything you stood for. Larusso takes this in without a flicker. I was so sure that you and I were on opposite sides of the fence... and that you and your people were destroying this country -- Nico pauses, glances away across the grounds. -- The most painful realization of my life was that the people I worked for and you are not far apart. -- And there's not much difference between what you are and what I was. Larusso studies Nico a long moment. Then takes Nico's elbow. * * 347 OMITTED *

question: I will be candid with you. I knew, probably before you did, that you would be coming to me. I knew what you would ask... and I had every intention of refusing you. But it is a form of wisdom to know when to cease relying only upon yourself. You know, of course, that this Senator Harrison will never live to make his speech tomorrow. You know, too, that as long as this man... this torturer --
answer: Kurt Zagon.

question: -- As long as this Zagon lives, nothing I can do will guarantee your family's safety. 'Ecce non uomine, ecce bestie.' You know Dante? 'These are not men, these are animals.' Memorize this address. Have you got it in your mind? Nico nods. Larusso tears the paper into tiny shreds. * Thank you, Mr. Carlucci. I trust you will give my love to my niece, Rosa.
answer: I will do that, Mr. Larusso. I hope you will be well.

question: I will do that, Mr. Larusso. I hope you will be well.
answer: You got the architect's drawings? Wiring, floor plans -- Nico indicates a briefcase he is carrying.

question: It's all here. Nico turns to his uncle. Regards him with affection.
answer: I could help you from here on.

question: It's not your business. Grazie, tio caro. Branca pats Nico's cheek.
answer: Take care of yourself, Nicola. CUT TO:

question: That wasn't the plan, Nelson.
answer: Close range, huh? Never work. Place is rigged, scanned every 35 seconds.

question: I was thinking of a mine on the roof. Remote-triggered, when the chopper comes in.
answer: Roof's wired too. Sensors every fifteen feet. Fox's finger rests ready on the trigger. You can turn now. Slowly. Slooowly... Nico turns. We see Fox clearly now. His boyish features have weathered since his "spook" days in Vietnam. There is grey in his hair now I figured you'd do your recon from this building.

question: You're looking fit, Nelson.
answer: Getting a bit of a tire.

question: Your own tailor?
answer: Hong Kong.

question: You've gone a long way. Fox motions for Nico to dump his gun; Nico complies, dropping it gently into the briefcase. Nico takes half a step toward Fox. Fox shakes his head in warning.
answer: Uh uh. Uhhh-uh... I know what you can do when you get too close to a man. 367 CLOSEUP - NICO * NICO * I don't believe you, Fox. * 367A INT. BUILDING CORRIDOR - NIGHT * -- What's so hard to believe. I want to help you, you dumb guinea!

question: Fox the fixer.
answer: If I wanted to cap you, I'd have saved myself this chit-chat. Make big points for me to bring in your scalp. I'd be White House material.

question: Is that what Zagon is? One of your basement boys?
answer: Zagon's a rancher. 4000 acres in Costa Rica. Beautiful place.

question: Bought with what -- opium from Cambodia?
answer: And a ton a week of coke from other places.

question: Which he funnels here through Salvano. With the Company getting its cut.
answer: Legal tender.

question: Still dodging appropriations committees, eh, Nelson?
answer: That's my job, Nico. They arrive at an elevator. Keep your nose in the corner. When we get out, stay five paces ahead of me. Cross down to the garage.

question: The Senator couldn't be bought, could he? He was gonna blow the lid off, so you cleared Zagon to frost him --
answer: Keep walking.

question: But the priest found out somehow and ran here. You couldn't do the Senator's number 'till you knew if the priest had talked. So Zagon flew in with his little medical bag. Only by then I was in on it -- and you thought I might recognize his handiwork.
answer: If your name was Joe Smith I never would have caught it. But how many Nicola Toscani's are there?

question: You got it off the arrest sheet.
answer: I tried to warn you, old buddy. I knew you had wiretaps. and I knew you wouldn't let 'em go.

question: Only I was too dumb to crack it. I was so busy trying to figure a code, I didn't even recognize Zagon's voice. It's all crystal clear to Nico now. So we kill our own senators now.
answer: Why not? The Romans did.

question: Are we the Romans?
answer: We're an empire too. Would you rather spoon borscht and quote Lenin? I'm trying to save you, asshole! I got a spot for you. Thailand, deep under, no names, no numbers --

question: Doing what -- processing heroin?
answer: You 'consult.' You 'assist.' You send checks to your family. Zagon won't touch you, you'll be on the team --

question: Fuck you.
answer: In five years you're out, with a fat Swiss account and a GS-15 pension. Nico stares at his old friend with contempt. He sees the gun under Fox's coat, but he's too tired and too disgusted to care --

question: You know, Fox, right now in Israel they're trying some 80-year-old camp guard for war crimes. And all around our country there are guys on Death Row for killing one person, two people. And probably they all deserve it -- He takes a step toward Fox. Fox's hand tightens on his gun. -- but you and I know a couple guys personally who are responsible for the murder of at least what... 60,000 non- military personnel. Viet. Lao. Thai. Cambodian. Librarians, teachers, doctors... women, children... and that's just a sliver of it. Fox tries to maintain a hard face. But his own guilty conscience is working -- We've wiped out entire fucking countries. And not one agent --
answer: Stop right there!

question: I didn't bring him, Nico. I swear it!
answer: Have you two been sharing fond memories? Reminiscing about the good old days?

question: Stay still! Don't fucking move!!
answer: Bring in our friend, Nelson. Salvano's muzzle covers Fox and Nico -- Be a good boy --

question: Dive, Nico!! He FIRES -- at Salvano! In the same instant, Salvano pulls his own trigger! Salvano's MACHINE GUN BURST cuts Fox down, a milli-second before Fox's .45 SLUG BLOWS Salvano off his feet! Pandemonium. Fox, dying, slings his .45 to Nico, who snatches it from the ground just as a HAIL of MACHINE GUN FIRE THUNDERS around him. Nico dives headlong behind a concrete column, which is instantly chewed to shreds by GUNFIRE. Zagon FIRES his MAC-10 on full automatic. A second agent hurries forward to outflank Nico. Nico pops from behind the column, DRILLS the agent broadside behind the ear, blowing the whole side of his head off! Guests and valets are shrieking in terror, hitting the deck in clusters, clawing and scrambling over each other for safety.
answer: Move! Nico springs from cover, FIRING, trying to bolt down the garage ramp, toward the lower levels. His path puts the first agent directly in Zagon's line of fire. Zagon doesn't hesitate; he OPENS UP on Nico, cutting down his own man -- Salvano has gotten to his feet, wounded, but still handling his gun. He joins Zagon, rushing forward -- No! I want him! I want him alive! 402 EXT. MIDLAND HOTEL - NIGHT * All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. We've got an hour before the honorable senator. You've got to learn to take time, smell the roses.
